channel.title: Portfolios on ChrisMaughan.com
channel.description: Recent content in Portfolios on ChrisMaughan.com

item.title: Game Of Life
item.description: Implementing Game of Life is a classic programming challenge.

item.title: Mgfx
item.description: Mgfx is a teaching framework I’ve used at York Developers. It has a simple support for building 2D and 3D applications in C++, with cross platform support.

item.title: Connect4
item.description: At the York Code Dojo, we spent an evening writing a connect 4 player. We pitched the results against each other to see which could play the best.

item.title: Mazes
item.description: Generating Mazes in code is a fun challenge. I’ve taught this at the York Code Dojo a couple of times.

item.title: Ray Tracer
item.description: Every graphics engineer should write a ray tracer at some point. I’ve done this a couple of times in C++ and Python.

item.title: Stocks
item.description: Understanding how Option Trades evolve over time is key to being able to trade them effectively.

item.title: MapMindz
item.description: MapMindz was a little application I wrote for Microsoft Surface 1. You could use it to build a Mind Map.

item.title: Boardz
item.description: Boardz was a collection of turn based board games released for iPhone and iPad. It included a server, player matching & chat.

item.title: Game
item.description: I like to tinker at Game Development occasionally; my hex planet app shown here is one such example. I sadly don’t have time to build a game - this is probably a retirement project ;) The screenshot below shows the game inside an engine based on ImGui. The shader implements an atmospheric scattering algorithm, which you can read about here.

item.title: Early Shader Debugger
item.description: Older versions of the DXSDK came with a reference rasterizer, that could simulate hardware shaders. It was very slow, but it had the advantage that you could use it to debug shaders.

item.title: DXSAS
item.description: To support our developers in implementing DXSAS shader semantics, I developed an example tool that implemented the SAS processing and allowed you to combine full screen effects.

item.title: NVIDIA FX Composer
item.description: FX Composer 2.5 is a powerful integrated development environment for shader authoring.

item.title: NV Shader Linker
item.description: NV Shader Linker was an attempt to build a traditional fixed function graphics pipeline using a series of shader fragments.

item.title: NVIDIA Effects Browser
item.description: My first job at NVIDIA was writing a tool to enable developers to understand vertex and pixel shaders - which were shortly going to be available in hardware. I worked on the NVIDIA Effects Browser which became part of the NVIDIA SDK.
